metadata.title: CVE-2020-6425 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Insufficient policy enforcement in extensions in Google Chrome prior to80.0.3987.149 allowed an attacker who convinced a user to install amalicious extension to bypass site isolation via a crafted ChromeExtension.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-6425` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 80.0.3987.149-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 80.0.3987.149-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 80.0.3987.149-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 80.0.3987.149-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 80.0.3987.149-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '80.0.3987.149-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
